Package main.Controller

Class AppointmentScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Controller.AppointmentScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AppointmentScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Author:
    Ron Mercier - 001406973 The Appointment Screen Controller handles all the processes related to customer appointments. Lambda Expressions were implemented in this controller to simplify the process of adding and modifying appointments to the database.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        Initializes the Appointment form and changes the language based on the user's settings to either French or English.
        If the user's locale fall outside either of those regions, the default language is English.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • save

        public void save​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Action event to save appointment to database
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception for save method. The Save method is used to add new appointment or modify existing appointments in the database. Before the appointment is saved, it checks that all fields are filled out and valid. It also checks the appointment time to make sure it is within business hours and doesn't overlap with an existing appointment.

      • cancel

        public void cancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Action event to cancel current process
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception for cancel method Cancel event that brings the user back to the main page.

        public boolean formValidation()

      • isAppointmentOverlapping

        public boolean isAppointmentOverlapping​(java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                                        java.time.LocalDateTime end)
                                 throws BusinessHoursException
        Validates that the appointment being added does not overlap with an existing appointment in the database.
        Parameters:
        start - Start time
        end - End Time
        Returns:
        true if appointment does not overlap another appointment.
        Throws:
        BusinessHoursException - used for appointment overlap

      • isModifiedAppointmentOverlapping

        public boolean isModifiedAppointmentOverlapping​(java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                                                java.time.LocalDateTime end,
                                                int id)
                                         throws BusinessHoursException
        Validates that the appointment being modified does not overlap with an existing appointment in the database.
        Parameters:
        start - Start time
        end - End time
        id - Appointment id
        Returns:
        returns true if exception is found
        Throws:
        BusinessHoursException - Exception for business hours
